{"step_by_step_thinking": "Cerebrohepatorenal syndrome, also known as Zellweger syndrome, is a peroxisomal disorder. Peroxisomes are responsible for the breakdown of very long-chain fatty acids. In this syndrome, the peroxisomes are not functioning properly, leading to an accumulation of very long-chain fatty acids in various tissues, including the brain.", "answer_choice": "C. Very long-chain fatty acid"}
